text.headline: BASIS schools 1998-2017
text.text: The first BASIS school opened in Tucson in 1998. Since then, the small charter school has grown into an international network of charter, private and international schools.

media.caption: Natalie West, right, goes over some work with classmate Danielle Brown (both are 11) while at BASIS Charter School. West transferred from another charter school, Tucson Christian School, mostly to save money. Her father, Carroll, is on the BASIS school board and volunteers to monitor school lunch breaks. Photo taken December 1998.

text.headline: The flagship school
text.text: After struggling to nail down a school building, BASIS Tucson opened for the 1998-1999 school year in rented space.

text.headline: Second BASIS charter school opens
text.text: BASIS opened its second school in Scottsdale, Ariz.

media.caption: Left to right, Matt Balanda, Robert Lee, physics teacher, standing in back, Andy Berger, middle, and Sean Saleh, work on a study in 2D kinematics project during APC Physics class at BASIS Tucson charter school, Wednesday, Aug. 20, 2008 in Tucson, Ariz. BASIS was pegged by Newsweek as number 3 school in the nation last year and it rated it number 1 in the country this year.
media.credit: James S. Wood / Arizona Daily Star

text.headline: No. 1 school in America
text.text: Newsweek named BASIS Tucson the No.1 school in America.

media.caption: John Pedicone, superintendent of Tucson Unified School District speaks to the audience at the Doubletree on education reform in Arizona with Michael Block from the Basis Educational Group on Feb. 10, 2011

text.headline: BASIS.ed
text.text: BASIS founders Michael and Olga Block established a private education management company, BASIS.ed to handle the charter schools' management and operations.

media.caption: From left to right up front with the teacher are -- Kimberly Huynh, 14, Emily Jue, 14, Sydney Jackson, 14 and on the right is the teacher Kevin Mathews as they are heating magnesium in a small container over a burner during a chemistry class at Basis charter school Friday September 25, 2009 in Tucson.

text.headline: Film calls BASIS a 'model'
text.text: A documentary film called 'Two Million Minutes' called BASIS' education a model for schools across the country.

media.caption: Former speaker of the house Newt Gingrich and the Rev. Al Sharpton are speaking to students at BASIS high school Thursday October 1 , 2009 in Tucson, Arizona.

text.headline: Newt Gingrich and Rev. Al Sharpton tour BASIS
text.text: Newt Gingrich and Rev. Al Sharpton jointly toured BASIS Tucson as part of a nationwide tour to study successful schools.

text.headline: Third BASIS charter school opens
text.text: BASIS Oro Valley opened for the 2010-2011 school year.

text.headline: Three new charter schools in Arizona
text.text: BASIS Chandler, Flagstaff and Peoria charter schools opened.

text.headline: First non-Arizona charter school opens
text.text: BASIS opened a charter school in Washington D.C., the first BASIS school outside of Arizona. BASIS Tucson expanded to include an additional school, BASIS Tucson North and BASIS Phoenix also opened. The network reached 5,319 students and continued to appear in national school rankings.

text.headline: BASIS expands to Texas
text.text: BASIS opened its first charter school in San Antonio, Texas. It also opened two additional campuses in Arizona -- in Mesa and Ahwatukee.

text.headline: Private venture begins
text.text: First BASIS private schools opened in Brooklyn, N.Y. and Silicon Valley, Calif. They are operated by BASIS Independent, another for-profit entity within the network. Three additional charter schools also opened. They are: BASIS Phoenix Central, Prescott and Oro Valley Primary.

text.headline: International expansion
text.text: Flagship international school opened in Shenzhen, China. From the charter operation, BASIS Goodyear, Goodyear Primary, Chandler Primary South and Scottsdale Primary opened.

text.headline: Continued expansion
text.text: New private schools opened in McLean, Va. Fremont, Calif., as well as BASIS Chandler Primary North charter school.

media.caption: Exterior of BASIS Phoenix South Primary, 5700 S. 19th Ave., on Sept. 13, 2017, in Phoenix, Ariz.

text.headline: Schools in low-income areas
text.text: BASIS opened primary charter school in South Phoenix, called Phoenix South Primary. The network plans to continue opening new schools in underserved areas, including in Baton Rouge and South Tucson. A second international campus opens in Guangzhou, China.
